document_data.caption: Fortune Hall, labeled as "Tymora", on a simple 14{{th}} century DR map.
document_data.name: Fortune Hall
document_data.mainbody: '''Fortune Hall''' was a temple in the city of [[Silverymoon]] dedicated to the goddess [[Tymora]].
document_data.Location: Fortune Hall was located in the eastern part of the [[Northbank]] section of Silverymoon, northeast of the [[Silverglen]] and west of the [[Tower of Balance]].
document_data.Structure: This temple was rather small in size.
document_data.Activities: The clergy of this temple sponsored a parlor on the southern shore of Silverymoon, near the [[River Rauvin]], in which soldiers would play games of chance.
document_data.Inhabitants: Fortune Hall was run in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] by the [[priest]]ess [[Shermata Cheng]]. This came to an end ''circa'' [[1372 DR]], when she was killed while out exploring with a band of [[adventurer]]s. She was mourned for a [[tenday]] period before being swiftly replaced by [[Aratha Sul]], much to the objection of some that it was occurring too soon.
